name: Different Places In The USA Quiz | USA | 10 Questions

questions.text: In what state are people allowed to cast absentee ballots from space?
questions.explanation:
Texas.

	Texas is the home of the Houston Space Center where most of the astronauts call home.

questions.text: Which of the five Great Lakes is the only one entirely inside the USA?
questions.explanation:
Lake Michigan & Michigan.

	This is true and I did not know this.  I was looking at a map the other day and saw it.  Well I did know it, but forgot it someplace along the way.

questions.text: The very first skyscraper was built in this city.  Which city?
questions.explanation:
Chicago.

	In 1884 to be exact.  The funny thing about this skyscraper is that it was just ten stories high.

questions.text: The Chrysler building is in which city in the USA?
questions.explanation:
New York.

	Walter Chrysler built his 77 story building in the middle of the depression.  It provided a lot of work for people who really needed jobs.

questions.text: In what state of the United States is the precise center of North America?
questions.explanation:
North Dakota.

	Exactly, it is Rugby, North Dakota.

questions.text: This state is home to Wayne National Forest.  John Glenn was born here, and Jerry Springer was on the news, not in the news.  What state am I in?
questions.explanation:
Ohio.

	In 2003 Ohio will have its 200th anniversary.  This is my home state as well as many others, including  Sarah Jessica Parker, just to name a few.

questions.text: Lou Gehrig, one of our greatest baseball players was born in this city.  I want to go see his home where he grew up.  Where do I go?
questions.explanation:
New York City.

	His nickname, the "Iron Horse".  Born 1903 Henry Louis Gehrig, died 1941.

questions.text: Tallahassee, Florida was the only Confederate capital east of the Missisippi not captured during the U.S. Civil War.
questions.explanation:
True.

	According to the book "Our Great Civil War" this is true.

questions.text: The Delaware Indians called this place Turtle Island.
questions.explanation:
North America.

	Oh the beautiful giant sea turtles were the ones that they were making note of.

questions.text: I am at the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame.  Which city am I in now?
questions.explanation:
Cleveland.

	It was built in 1995 in Cleveland, Ohio.  Designed by I.M. Pei.  I have been there and it is a very beautiful building.  It is made of glass, granite, and painted white steel.
